alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 15 at 2:01PM MST until February 15 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR AREAS ALONG AND EAST OF I-25 AND ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 EXCLUDING THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY...ABOVE AVERAGE TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS... .Above average temperatures will combine with strong southwest winds, very low relative humidity, and an unstable airmass to continue producing critical fire weather conditions mainly along and south of I-40 and along and east of I-25 excluding the Rio Grande Valley below any significant snowpack through early this evening. Strong southwest winds will continue through tonight into Wednesday across portions of the eastern plains. A Red Flag Warning is now in effect Wednesday for the East Central Plains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains, Northeast Highlands, Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northwest Highlands and West Central Highlands until 6 PM this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20-35 mph with gusts of 40-45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 5 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
